Verses.26: Now in the sixth month of Elizabeth's pregnancy, the angel Gabriel was sent from God to Nazareth, a city in Galilee.
Verses.27: To a woman there named Mary, who was a virgin. She was betrothed to a man whose name was Joseph, one of the descendants of David.
Verses.28: Gabriel having coming in, he said to her, "Greetings, greatly favored one! The Lord is with you."
Verses.29: But Mary was very confused by this statement, and wondered what kind of greeting this was.
Verses.30: Then the angel said to her, "Do not be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God.
Verses.31: You will conceive and give birth to a son, and you shall call Him Jesus.
Verses.32: He will be great, and He will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give Him the throne of His father David.
Verses.33: He will also reign over the house of Jacob forever, and His kingdom will have no end."
Verses.34: Mary said to the Angel, "How will this be, since I am still a virgin?"
Verses.35: The angel answered her, "The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you. For that reason, this holy child will be called the Son of God.
Verses.36: Even your relative Elizabeth has herself conceived a son in her old age, and she who was called infertile is now in her sixth month.
Verses.37: For with God nothing will be impossible."
Verses.38: Mary proclaimed, "I am a servant of the Lord. May your word to me be fulfilled." Then the angel left her.

Changes: 2022-11-28 - Paul Prins: First translation of chapter 1:26-38.
